problems.title: Max Consecutive Ones III (Sliding Window)
problems.description:
Given a binary array nums and an integer k, return the maximum number of consecutive 1's in the array if you can flip at most k 0's.

Input Format:
First line: two integers n and k.
Second line: n space-separated integers (0s and 1s).

Output Format:
Print a single integer: the maximum number of consecutive 1s.
hintsList: Think about how to use a sliding window to optimize the solution.
Consider using a frequency map or two pointers to track the window state.
